title.narrative: WAPP APL 1 (1st Phase - COASTAL TRANSMISSION BACKBONE)

description.narrative: The developmental objective of the WAPP APL 1project is to increase access of WAPP "Zone A" coastal states (Benin, Cote d'Ivoire, Ghana, Nigeria and Togo) to more stable and reliable electricity as a means to alleviate power supply deficits and/or to reduce their collective vulnerability to drought-induced power supply disruptions. This developmental objective is to be achieved by: (a) implementinga WAPP Cooperation Agreement to facilitate enhanced cross-border power exchanges between the four concerned Transmission System Operators (TSOs), namely CEB, CIE, NEPA and VU; and (b) establishing and fully deploying the cross-border electricity transfer capabilities of the proposed 330kV WAPP Coastal Transmission Backbone. Outcomes The expected outcomes include: 1. Increasing cross-border electricity trade between WAPP "Zone A" Coastal States; 2. Reductions in power transfer losses in the principal transmission networks of the WAPP "Zone A" coastal states; 3. More cost efficient coverage of peak power demand through economy power exchanges between WAPP "Zone A" coastal states. The WAPP APL 1 project would be considered successful if it provides ample capacity for unconstrained cross-border electricity trade between the five ECOWAS Member States for up to at least 2020.

condition.narrative: Auth. to furnish Assoc. (a) other info re records/accnts & audit of such financial statements as Assoc. may periodically request;(b) prepare & furnish financial monitoring rpt, satisfactory to Assoc
Borrower shall have financial statements referred to in para. (a) of this Section audited each FY, by independent auditors usingconsistently applied auditing standards acceptable to the Association.
Borrower shall, by November 30 of each year, update the Project Implementation Manual, as agreed with the Association.
Ensure that all records evidencing SOE expenditure are retained at least 1 year after Association has recv'd the audit report forthe FY in which the last withdrawal from the Credit account was made.
Except as Assoc. shall agree, Authority shall not incur any new debt unless net revenue the following FY will equal at least 1.3times the est. debt service requirement
First FMR to be furnished to Assoc. no later than 45 days after end of 1st calendar quarter after Effective date, & cover from1stincurrence of proj expense through end of such 1st calendar quwater
Review with the Association the report referred to in para. (b) of this Section.
Review with the Association the report referred to in para. (b) of this Section.
The Authority shall prepare and furnish a plan for the future opeation fo hte Project not later than 6 months beofre the Closingdate.
The Authority shall prepare and furnish to the Association, a report integrating the results of the M&E activities performedpursuant to para. (a) (indicators) of this Section on Project progress.
The Authority shall, by Nov. 30 of each year update the Project Implementation Manual
The Authority to furnish (a) certified copies of financial statements referred to in para. a of this section, and (b)auditor'sopinion on said statements to Assoc. no later than 6 mos. after FY-end
The Authority to have its financial statements for each FY audited, in accord. w/consistently applied auditing standards byindepend. auditors acceptable to the Assoc. and appointed by Mar. each year
afford the Association an reasonable opportunity to ecxhange views with the Borrower on said plan.
afford the Association an reasonable opportunity to exchange views with the Authority on said plan.
enable the Association's representatives to examine such records.
ensure that such statements of expenditure are included in any audit that the Association may have requested pursuant to para. (b)of this Section.
furnish certified copies of the audited financial statements referred to in para. (a) of this Section to the Association notlaterthan 6 months after the end of each FY, along w/auditor's opinion.
furnish other information concerning records, accounts and the audit of such financial statements and said auditors to theAssociation as requested from time to time.
prepare and furnish to the Association a plan for the future operation of the Project, based on guidelines acceptable to theAssociation six months before the Closing date.
prepare and furnish to the Association, a report integrating the results of the M&E activities performed pursuant to para (a) (EMPand RAP) of this Section on Project progress.
